meanings.definition: The action of putting items into a container for transportation or storage.
meanings.sent1: I helped with the packing of our suitcases before our trip.
meanings.sent2: The moving company provided packing services for fragile items.
meanings.sent3: The packing of the picnic basket was like a game of Tetris.
meanings.sent4: Her packing skills were so efficient, it was like watching a magician at work.
meanings.sent5: The packing of the boxes was so organized, it felt like a satisfying puzzle coming together.

meanings.definition: Material used to protect or cushion goods during transportation.
meanings.sent1: The fragile items were wrapped in bubble wrap for packing.
meanings.sent2: The packing around the delicate vase prevented it from breaking.
meanings.sent3: The packing material felt like a cloud protecting the items inside.
meanings.sent4: The packing acted like a shield, keeping the contents safe during the journey.
meanings.sent5: The packing material was so soft, it felt like a hug around the objects.

meanings.definition: The act of filling a space tightly with people or objects.
meanings.sent1: The tight packing of the concert hall made it feel crowded.
meanings.sent2: The packing of the bus during rush hour was uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The packing of the elevator was so tight, it felt like a sardine can.
meanings.sent4: The packing of the stadium during the game was like fitting pieces of a puzzle together.
meanings.sent5: The packing of the room with furniture made it cozy and inviting.
